quotes.quote:
Most people ignore most poetry
because
most poetry ignores most people.
quotes.author: Adrian Mitchell

quotes.quote: It's easier to quote poets than to read them.
quotes.author: Allison Barrows

quotes.quote: There exist only three beings worthy of respect: the priest, the soldier, the poet. To know, to kill, to create.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.quote: The freedom of poetic license.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: A poem is no place for an idea.
quotes.author: Edgar Watson Howe

quotes.quote: My poems are hymns of praise to the glory of life.
quotes.author: Edith Sitwell

quotes.quote: Poetry is the deification of reality.
quotes.author: Edith Sitwell

quotes.quote: All slang is a metaphor, and all metaphor is poetry.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: A poet more than thirty years old is simply an overgrown child.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Many brave men lived before Agamemnon; but all are overwhelmed in eternal night, unwept, unknown, because they lack a sacred poet.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.quote: The worst tragedy for a poet is to be admired through being misunderstood.
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: You don't have to suffer to be a poet; adolescence is enough suffering for anyone.
quotes.author: John Ciardi

quotes.quote: Poetry should please by a fine excess and not by singularity. It should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost as a remembrance.
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.quote: Poetry often enters through the window of irrelevance.
quotes.author: M. C. Richards

quotes.quote: I was working on the proof of one of my poems all the morning, and took out a comma. In the afternoon I put it back again.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: In science one tries to tell people, in such a way as to be understood by everyone, something that no one ever knew before. But in poetry, it's the exact opposite.
quotes.author: Paul Dirac

quotes.quote: A poem is never finished, only abandoned.
quotes.author: Paul Valery

quotes.quote: Every English poet should master the rules of grammar before he attempts to bend or break them.
quotes.author: Robert Graves

quotes.quote: A poet who reads his verse in public may have other nasty habits.
quotes.author: Robert Heinlein

quotes.quote: A prose writer gets tired of writing prose, and wants to be a poet. So he begins every line with a capital letter, and keeps on writing prose.
quotes.author: Samuel McChord Crothers

quotes.quote: A poet ought not to pick nature's pocket. Let him borrow, and so borrow as to repay by the very act of borrowing. Examine nature accurately, but write from recollection, and trust more to the imagination than the memory.
quotes.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quotes.quote:
A poet's hope: to be,
like some valley cheese,
local, but prized elsewhere.
quotes.author: W. H. Auden

quotes.quote: The poet judges not as a judge judges but as the sun falling around a helpless thing.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman
